info.title: Atlas Engine API
info.description: Generated from Express routes. Schemas may be refined over time.

get.description:
Returns a lightweight health signal for Atlas Engine.

Use this endpoint for load balancers, uptime checks, and container orchestration probes. It is intentionally fast and does not validate external dependencies.

This endpoint is **public** and does not require authentication.
get.summary: Get System Healthz

get.description:
Returns operational metrics for Atlas Engine (Prometheus-compatible output).

Use this to monitor request rates, latencies, and error patterns. Protect access in production since metrics can expose internal service behavior.

This endpoint requires authentication (commonly `x-org-id` and `x-license-key`, or an auth token depending on the route).
get.summary: Get System Metrics

get.description:
Get license-related state for your organization.

Use these endpoints to validate access, check license status, refresh entitlements, or apply a license payload depending on your deployment flow.

This endpoint is **public** and does not require authentication.

parameters.name: x-org-id
parameters.description: Organization identifier used to scope the request.

parameters.name: x-license-key
parameters.description: License key used to authorize requests for your organization.

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: Organization identifier used to scope the request.

parameters.name: license_key
parameters.description: License key used to authorize requests for your organization.

get.description:
Get deployment metadata.

Use these endpoints to verify which version/build of Atlas Engine is running, useful for debugging and support.

This endpoint requires authentication (commonly `x-org-id` and `x-license-key`, or an auth token depending on the route).
get.summary: Get Deployment Deployment Version

get.description:
Get the SAML authentication and session flow.

Use these endpoints to configure an IdP, discover an org from user email, initiate login, handle ACS callbacks, and manage logout/session state.

This endpoint is **public** and does not require authentication.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Organization identifier.

post.description:
Create agents used to execute workflows in Atlas Engine.

Agents represent runnable configurations (tools, policies, and runtime settings). Use these endpoints to create and manage agents, trigger agent tasks, fetch agent memory, and update agent lifecycle state.

This endpoint requires authentication (commonly `x-org-id` and `x-license-key`, or an auth token depending on the route).

parameters.name: license_key
parameters.description: License key used to authorize requests for your organization.

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: Organization identifier used to scope the request.

Use these endpoints to configure an IdP, discover an org from user email, initiate login, handle ACS callbacks, and manage logout/session state.

This endpoint is **public** and does not require authentication.

parameters.name: license_key
parameters.description: License key used to authorize requests for your organization.

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: Organization identifier used to scope the request.

get.summary: Get Github Oauth Oauth Github User

tags.name: AI

tags.description: Create, list, update, and manage automations.

tags.description: Organization branding and UI customization settings.

tags.name: Chat
tags.description: Chat endpoints, including streaming responses and history.

tags.description: Install, configure, test, and run connectors and integrations.
